title: Emails not showing up in folders
content: In the process of migrating away from Outlook to Thunderbird. Installed Thunderbird and connected to gmail using IMAP easy enough. Used ReliefJet Essentials to convert a PST file to MBOX. That process appeared to go well. Folders were created during the process and folder structures corresponded to the folder structures in the original PST. Each folder also contained corresponding *.mbox files. .mbox file contents looked appropriate when opening with notepad. Problem begins here. My intention was to access the those messages under "Local Folders." Under local folders account settings, I pointed Message Storage 'local directly' to the folder where the directories and .mbox files are stored. After a restart, Thunderbird sees the folders BUT NOT the individuals messages in the folders. What have a done wrong...?

title: Profile lost for default account
content:
Default profile lost / hidden.

For the last few days, I have been getting certificate errors. I decided to move from Pop to Imap which fixed the problem. Somewhere in creating the new IMAP account, it asked me if I want to have messages moved to another account, to which I said yes, which would keep me from having to move all of those folders and re-create the inbox structure. Well, that somehow removed that default profile. I backup regularly, but just found out that the appdata branch is a hidden folder and did not get picked up. Okay, fine. However, my email folders are on a data drive and are fully backed up. I have all of the data, i just need to re-establish the profile. If I go to appdata .... profiles ... , that account is in there. I can't import it. I can't even import the messages. Can you guide me to getting my default account visible again. I'm sure there are already articles and answers, and I browsed but could not find the right one in the many, many answers provided. I'm very tech savvy, so I'm sure I can follow the guidance given.

title: Nelze elektronicky podepisovat
content:
Dobrý den,

přestal fungovat elektronický podpis od České pošty. Při odeslání zprávy se objeví hláška, že certifokát buď vypršel nebo nebyl najit.

Můj certifikát je platný ještě 2 roky.

dle postupu v https://support.mozilla.org/cs/questions/1456735 jsem vše odebral, znovu nainstaloval i kořenové certifikáty a znovu restartoval

viz návod: https://pkubes.wordpress.com/2023/05/24/thunderbird-nechce-digitalne-podepsat-zpravu/

title: sending to multiple addresses  - how to automatically send to all the single addresses
content:
problem. i do volunteer work. i send bulk email, with about 40 recipients, using Blind Copy for security.

COMCAST.NET is blocking my emails if i send a group email, so the comcast.net recipients don't receive it. I've been told to send to smaller number of recipients, but it is just not practical for what i do. this is not a paid job or a spam job. i do maintenance work in my homeowner association and send out maintenace emails.

IS there any way to generate an email for multiple recipients, an have it SEND to the individual recipients separately (automatically)?

or some way to have it automatically send to the group, but break it into groups of 10 recipients, or something like that?

any way to get my email through, legitimately, without having to create multiple groups, is appreciated.

Ive read comcast info, they say that they block stuff if it has over 100 recipients, but i have 40 or less in my group email, and they're not even all to comcast.net recipients.

thanks

title: Cannot send or recieve messages after connecting to Xbox, e-mail server doesn't support OAuth2
content:
Hello,

Recently, I set up two-step verification on my Microsoft account. Since my e-mail server is not connected to Microsoft, I was able to continue using Thunderbird without issue. However, after having signed in to my Xbox account after not accessing it for several months, I became unable to login to my e-mail server, as it failed to accept my password or any other I put in.

After searching for solutions, the general consensus I found was that Thunderbird was attempting to connect to Microsoft's servers, but couldn't because its authentication method was set to 'Normal Password'. I've tried changing my authentication method, but changing my authentication method to anything other than 'Normal Password' gives me a 'Your e-mail provider does not support this authentication method' message.

I've had this problem before (see https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1432194), which happened after I set up two-step verification initially, but i don't know how I solved the problem before, and obviously it wasn't a permanent solution.

What I find strange is that, since I don't use an Outlook account, this issue either shouldn't be happening at all, or I shouldn't have been able to regain access in the first place.

I'm not sure what to do next. Since my provider apparently doesn't support OAuth2, is there anything I can do about this, or am I pretty much sunk? Any help would be appreciated.

Specs: E-mail provider: Spectrum (Listed as "Roadrunner/TWC") E-mail server: mail.twc.com, IMAP, SSL/TLS, Port 993, Normal Password Outgoing server: mail.twc.com, IMAP, STARTTLS, Port 587, Normal Password ISP Provider: Charter Communications OS: Windows 10 Thunderbird version: 128

Thanks in advance.
creator: Plasmius

title: Thunderbird Google calendar showing duplicate birthday entries
content:
In my Google calendar, I have the automatic birthday calendar. The birthdays of people in my (Google) contact list will appear in my calendar. See the first attached image.

In Thunderbird, I have subscribed to my Google calendar (and Google contacts), but birthdays are duplicated in my Thunderbird (Google) calendar. See the second attached image. One birthday appears to be originating from the Google birthday (red) calendar, and one from my main/personal Google (green) calendar (which has two icons that I don't know the meaning of).

Why are birthdays being duplicated in Thunderbird?

In Thunderbird, I can resolve the issue by unchecking the option to 'Sync from <email address>' in the settings for the birthday calendar in my Google account. See the third attached image. This solves the problem for Thunderbird; see the fourth attached image. But then in my Google calendar, birthdays disappear. See the fifth attached image.

Is there a solution that allows the birthdays calendar to be synced correctly in both Google and Thunderbird without showing duplicates and without disappearing?
creator: thunderbirds_are_go
